Posts.Title: Metaplastic invasive ductal carcinoma

Posts.Content: Can you tell me more about your situation? Where type of cancer? I'm not sure what to do at this point. I've got 5 more chemo treatments.
Posts.Title: Immediate reconstruction

Posts.Content: On Aug 01, 2016 6:24 PM Lakevisitor wrote: Hi, If you touch my pride ID you will be able to read other replies that given more detail to my history. I am diagnosed as stage 4 neurondoctrine neoplasm carcinoid. My cancer is a slow growing type that chemo or radiation will not help. As the tumors appear, they will have to be removed. The cancer is determined by levels of some hormone in my blood. When levels get too high, I will require a monthly shot that will help suppress the hormone my body is producing. I have been a work in progress for about 41 years now. My first sign was a tumor in my right lung the size of an orange. Like I stated before, immediate reconstruction worked well for me. Unfortunately, everyone heals at a different pace as well as everyone handles pain differently. Best of luck to you. Thanks, I will look at the posts you suggested.
Posts.Title: Immediate reconstruction

Posts.Content: Today they couldn't get a blood return with one side of my port so they used they side they was used last week. Anyone know about this?
